vehicles.description: Yellow heavy truck on the right side of the road, occupying the right lane and moving in the same direction as the ego car
vehicles.explanation: The slow-moving heavy truck may cause the ego car to adjust speed or change lanes to overtake.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A motorcyclist on the right side of the road, ahead of the ego car, also traveling in the same direction
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The ego car needs to maintain a safe distance from the motorcyclist and be prepared for any potential sudden movements.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there are two road users present. The first is a yellow heavy truck on the right side of the road, occupying the right lane and moving in the same direction as the ego car. The presence of the slow-moving heavy truck may require the ego car to adjust its speed or change lanes to overtake the truck safely.

Additionally, there is a motorcyclist ahead of the ego car, also on the right side of the road and traveling in the same direction. The ego car must maintain a safe following distance from the motorcyclist and be prepared for any potential sudden movements the motorcyclist might make.

There are no traffic signs, traffic lights, traffic cones, barriers, or other objects reported in the image that affect the driving behavior of the ego car.

1.description and explanation: A construction vehicle, specifically a yellow mobile crane, is visible in the traffic scenario. This type of vehicle is used for lifting heavy materials and plays a crucial role in construction projects. Its presence on the road generally indicates ongoing or impending construction work nearby. For the ego car's future driving behavior, it implies the need for increased alertness and caution. The driver should prepare for potential sudden stops or reduced speed limits, and be aware of construction workers and machinery that may enter the roadway.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe following distance from the heavy truck and motorcyclist, be prepared for slower speeds due to the truck in the right lane. Monitor the motorcyclist for any sudden changes in behavior or direction. Due to the wet road conditions, reduce speed accordingly to maintain vehicle control and extend stopping distances. Do not attempt to overtake unless it can be done safely with a clear view of the oncoming lane and sufficient space to return to the lane.
